title: Incredible moment Australian cricketer Glenn 'The Big Show' Maxwell predicts his brilliant run out
text:
Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell predicted an incredible run out while commentating on the field during Australia's first T20 international against Sri Lanka.

'The Big Show' was mic'd up with Fox Cricket commentators while stationed at deep extra cover in the outfield during Sri Lanka's innings chasing Australia's total of 233.

The 31-year-old was calmly chatting with Mark Howard, Isa Guha and Adam Gilchrist when spin bowler Ashton Agar walked in for his final ball of the 13th over to Wanindu Hasaranga.

Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell (pictured left with Mitchell Starc) has predicted an incredible run out while commentating on the field during Australia's first T20 international against Sri Lanka

Hasaranga chipped the ball over the infield, sparking Maxwell into action, with his on-field microphone picking up him saying 'run out' as he sped towards the ball.

Maxwell took the ball in his right hand and fired it to wicket keeper Alex Carey, who knocked off the bails to dismiss Hasaranga for five runs.

'You like that?' Maxwell laughed, as the commentators celebrated his genius prediction.

'He looked a little bit slow off the mark there, so I had to go keeper’s end.'

Howard praised Maxwell's 'bullet arm,' while Guha called his fielding 'sensational.'

'What’s so good about that is he’s talking to us, so he’s literally having to get himself ready to field,' Guha said.

'He’s trained so much in the outfield, he’s fielded so much in that region that it is just second nature.'

Maxwell contributed with more than just his fielding in the match, launching a rapid fire 62 from 28 balls at the close of Australia's innings, including three sixes.

Australia's total of 233 proved to be too much for Sri Lanka, who were bowled out for 99 in Adelaide.
